page.title: 10MARKET GARDENING-HOLKER MOSS
page.content: Market gardening is a prominent activity in the lower land of the area because the soil is very fertile.The climate is cool and moist and as a result the less hardy crops have to be grown in{greenhouses.}Much of the work is done by hand with only limited use of machinery.{Seasonal labour}is used at busy times of year especially when crops are ready for picking.Produce grown includes{strawberries,tomatoes, {lettuce,potatoes,pot-plants}and {flowers.}Christmas trees are grown on less fertile land to cater for the seasonal demand.Produce is sold from the premises or from market stalls run by the growers at{Ulverston Market. The market gardens are a noticeable part of the Mosses landscape.Their neat,well organised appearance contrasts sharply with the irregular- ity of wood,marsh and moor.
